AttackerCapabilities: Understanding of URL parsing and encoding
Ability to identify and exploit access restrictions

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that by bypassing the IP address restriction, they can access the /debug/answer endpoint.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker sends a request to the /%64ebug/answer endpoint, utilizing URL encoding to bypass the keyword filtering and IP address restriction.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully accesses the /debug/answer endpoint and obtains the first flag.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker hypothesizes that by injecting a specially crafted host value, they can manipulate the URL parsing process to access the /api/true-answer endpoint.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker sends a request to the target host with the injected host value "\debug\answer".
StepDetails.Result: The Angular application parses the URL and retrieves the path as /debug/answer, allowing the attacker to access the /api/true-answer endpoint and obtain the second flag.
